title: What is the ectrlplot package?
text: R package, developed PRU team make process creating publication-ready graphics -house style, using R’s ggplot2 library, reproducible process. package constisted following functions: theme_pru() add PRU style ggplot2 graphics add_logo() add EUROCONTROL logo source pru_pal() see colour palette PRU team scale_color_pru(), scale_colour_pru() & scale_fill_pru() use colour palette PRU team

title: What is the ectrlplot package?
text: package can used give graphics made PRU team consistent customized look.

title: What is the ectrlplot package?
text: following examples help understand use ectrlplot package components step step.

title: What is the ectrlplot package?
text: Let’s start basic scatterplot example.
code: p1 <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) +   geom_point() +   labs(title = 'Scatterplot example in ggplot2',      subtitle = 'A plot that is only useful for demonstration purposes') p1

what: Discrete color & fill scales based on the PRU palette
title: What is the ectrlplot package?
text: Use PRU color palette adding scale_color_pru(), scale_colour_pru() scale_fill_pru().
code: library(scales)  p2 <- ggplot(mpg[1:48,], aes(displ, hwy, colour = class)) +  geom_point() +  theme_pru() +  scale_color_pru() + labs(title = 'Scatterplot example in ggplot2',      subtitle = 'A plot that is only useful for demonstration purposes') p2

title: What is the ectrlplot package?
text: want modify components theme_pru(), use theme() add preferences. example, Y axis line added Y axis grid lines panel removed. See modify components theme.
code: p3 <- p2 + theme(axis.line.y = ggplot2::element_line(colour = "#D5D5D5",                                           size = 1.2,                                           linetype = "solid",                                           lineend = "round"),            panel.grid.major.y = ggplot2::element_blank()) p3

title: What is the ectrlplot package?
text: Finish plot adding logo, source filepath want saved. EUROCONTROL logo default package. want use logo, modify function adding parameter logo_image_path.
code: add_logo(plot_name = p3,          source = "Source: My source",          save_filepath = "thisismyplot.png",          width_pixels = 640,          height_pixels = 450)

title: What is the ectrlplot package?
text: Now, let’s see use ectrlplot package ggplot2 bar chart.
code: g1 <- ggplot(mpg[1:108,], aes(class)) +   geom_bar()  +   labs(title = 'Bar chart example in ggplot2',      subtitle = 'A plot that is only useful for demonstration purposes') g1

title: What is the ectrlplot package?

title: What is the ectrlplot package?
text: Now, grouping data class.  Use PRU color palette adding scale_fill_pru().
code: g2 <- ggplot(mpg[1:108,], aes(class)) +   geom_bar(aes(fill = manufacturer)) +   theme_pru() +   labs(title = 'Bar chart example in ggplot2',      subtitle = 'A plot that is only useful for demonstration purposes') g2 g3 <- g2 + scale_fill_pru() g3

what: Add Eurocontrol logo and save ggplot chart — add_logo
title: Add Eurocontrol logo and save ggplot chart — add_logo
text: Running function add Eurocontrol logo plot save specified location.

title: Add Eurocontrol logo and save ggplot chart — add_logo
code: add_logo(plot_name, source_name,   save_filepath = file.path(Sys.getenv("TMPDIR"), "tmp-nc.png"),   width_pixels = 640, height_pixels = 450,   logo_image_path = system.file("extdata", "euctrl-logo-wide.png",   package = "ectrlplot"))

title: Add Eurocontrol logo and save ggplot chart — add_logo
text: plot_name variable name plot created want format save source_name text want come text 'Source:' bottom left hand side chart save_filepath exact filepath want plot saved width_pixels Width pixels want save chart - defaults 640 height_pixels Height pixels want save chart - defaults 450 logo_image_path File path logo image want use right hand side chart, needs PNG file - defaults Eurocontrol logo sits within extdata folder package

title: Add Eurocontrol logo and save ggplot chart — add_logo
code: library(ggplot2)  myplot <- ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy)) + geom_point() + theme_pru()  + labs(title = 'Scatterplot example in ggplot2',      subtitle = 'A plot that is only useful for demonstration purposes') #> Warning: `expand_scale()` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.3.0. #> ℹ Please use `expansion()` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the ectrlplot package. #>   Please report the issue to the authors.  add_logo(plot_name = myplot, source = "Source: The source of my data", width_pixels = 640, height_pixels = 450, save_filepath = "path-name.png")   # If you want to use your own logo image, # change the path in the logo-image-path argument  if (FALSE) { add_logo(plot_name = myplot, source = "Source: The source of my data", save_filepath = "path-name.png", width_pixels = 640, height_pixels = 450, logo_image_path = "use-your-logo-image-path") }
